items.summary: Add Racing, Badminton, and Shooting as new sport categories to the backend game data. Pre-populate the backend with at least 2 game entries per new category (Racing, Badminton, Shooting), each with a name, sport category, short description, thumbnail image URL, and a working external game URL. Update any backend category validation or enums to include these three new categories.

Update the Games page (/games) category filter bar to include filter buttons for Racing, Badminton, and Shooting alongside the existing All, Cricket, Football, Basketball, and Tennis filters. Game cards for these new categories must render correctly using the existing GameCard component.

Update the homepage hero/about section in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx to include the R2S Sports Champion Pro app description. The section must highlight: six sports (Cricket, Football, Basketball, Racing, Badminton, Shooting) each with their emoji, smooth controls & realistic physics, offline & online play, unlock achievements and rewards, and compete with friends & global leaderboard. Use the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme and bold typography.

Create a Terms & Conditions page at route /terms in the React frontend. The page must display T&C content relevant to R2S Sports Champion Pro, structured with sections covering: (1) Acceptance of Terms; (2) Use of the App (permitted and prohibited uses); (3) User Accounts and Registration; (4) In-App Coins and Rewards (virtual currency, no real monetary value unless stated); (5) Leaderboard and Fair Play; (6) Intellectual Property; (7) Disclaimer of Warranties; (8) Limitation of Liability; (9) Changes to Terms; (10) Contact Us (email: mjkjbansal@gmail.com); (11) 'Last Updated: 2026' footer note. Style the page consistently with the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme (dark background, gold/red section headings, bold typography, Tailwind utility classes).

Add a 'Terms & Conditions' link to the Footer component (frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx) that navigates to the /terms route, placed alongside the existing Privacy Policy link. Register the /terms route in the TanStack Router configuration in frontend/src/App.tsx.
